If you're interested in a more lighthearted approach to genetic engineering, "The Secret of My Success" starring the talented Michael J. Fox might be worth checking out. It's a comedy about a man who uses genetic manipulation (albeit in a humorous context) to achieve success in the corporate world. Enjoy!

If you're interested in exploring a different genre but still want something with a bit of weirdness, "Connie and Carla" might be just the thing for you! This comedy tells the story of two chanteuses who flee to LA after a mix-up and start posing as drag queens. The film features some great performances by Nia Vardalos, Ian Gomez, David Duchovny, and Debbie Reynolds, making it a fun and entertaining watch!

I'd highly recommend "Casablanca" for you. This classic film features Humphrey Bogart as a cynical expatriate cafe owner who must decide whether to help his former lover and her fugitive husband escape the Nazis in French Morocco. It's a timeless tale of love, sacrifice, and morality set against a gripping backdrop of war. Enjoy!

If you're interested in more recent war films, "Lord of War" might be up your alley. Starring Nicolas Cage, it delves into the moral dilemmas faced by an arms dealer as he is pursued by an INTERPOL agent. It's a thought-provoking exploration of global conflict and the human cost behind the trade of weapons.
